targets.query: SELECT mean("average_response_ms") FROM "ping" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "url" fill(null)
SELECT "cpu_usage" FROM "autogen"."procstat" WHERE ("pattern"::tag = '.*' AND "cpu_usage"::field > 5) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "process_name"::tag
SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "path" = '/assets') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "path" = '/') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "path" = '/results') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "path" = '/srv') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("used_percent") FROM "disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "path" = '/space-slow') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("inodes_used")/mean("inodes_total") FROM "autogen"."disk" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "path"::tag fill(null)

panels.description: A Minion worker is used by openQA to perform background tasks like cleanup and saving needles. There is one worker *expected* to be online, visible under https://openqa.suse.de/minion/workers. The service `openqa-gru.service` on openqa.suse.de is supposed to provide the Minion worker.

targets.query: SELECT max("active") FROM "openqa_minion_workers" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(previous)
SELECT max(active) + max(inactive) FROM "openqa_minion_workers" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: openQA minion workers

panels.description: See Minion job details on https://openqa.suse.de/minion/jobs
panels.title: Minion Jobs

panels.description: See Minion job details on https://openqa.suse.de/minion/jobs
panels.title: Minion Jobs with failed script hook

targets.query: SELECT mean(total) as total, mean(used) as used, mean(cached) as cached, mean(free) as free, mean(buffered) as buffered  FROM "mem" WHERE "host" =~ /^$host$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host ORDER BY asc
SELECT "memory_usage" FROM "autogen"."procstat" WHERE ("pattern"::tag = '.*' AND "memory_usage"::field > 0.5) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "process_name"::tag
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_recv),1s)*8 as "in"  FROM "net" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND interface = 'eth1' AND $timeFilter) GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_sent),1s)*8 as "out" FROM "net" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND interface = 'eth1' AND $timeFilter)  GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_recv),1s)*8 as "in"  FROM "net" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND interface = 'eth0' AND $timeFilter) GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_sent),1s)*8 as "out" FROM "net" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND interface = 'eth0' AND $timeFilter)  GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)
SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "diskio" WITH KEY = "DESCRIPTION" WHERE "host" =~ /^$host$/ and "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(reads),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(writes),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE   ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_bytes),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/)  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(write_bytes),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ and "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_time),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE  ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/)  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(write_time),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE  ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "name" =~ /^$host_disks$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *

panels.description: Response time measured by the nginx proxy for requests with exclusion of some known routes which are allowed to run for much longer.

targets.query: SELECT min("response_time_s") FROM "nginx_log" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "request" !~ /\/api\/v1\/ws/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT max("response_time_s") FROM "nginx_log" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "request" !~ /\/api\/v1\/ws/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("response_time_s") FROM "nginx_log" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/ AND "request" !~ /\/api\/v1\/ws/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Nginx Response Time

panels.description: Active connections: The current number of active client connections including Waiting connections; Waiting: The current number of idle client connections waiting for a request.
panels.title: Nginx Connections

targets.query: SELECT sum("open_connections") FROM "postgresql" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time(10s) fill(null)
SELECT difference(mean("buffers_alloc")) FROM "postgresql" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$host$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description:
Worker slots which are able to connect to the web UI but report that they're broken.

This corresponds to the workers shown as "unavailable" on the web UI which also contains the reason the worker is broken: https://openqa.suse.de/admin/workers

Limited workers are reported as "Offline (limited)", this might mean there are too many workers registered, see https://progress.opensuse.org/issues/157690 for more details.
panels.title: Broken and limited workers

targets.query: SELECT (bottom(expiry,common_name,1)/60/60/24) as exp,common_name FROM "x509_cert" WHERE time >= now() - 1h

list.label: Used by influx queries on this dashboard
list.name: host

list.definition: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "diskio" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE "host" =~ /^$host$/ and "name" =~ /vd[a-z]$/
list.description: Variable containing all host disks (e.g. vda, vdb, etc.) to populate disk IO query rows
list.label: Disks
list.name: host_disks
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM "diskio" WITH KEY = "name" WHERE "host" =~ /^$host$/ and "name" =~ /vd[a-z]$/
